definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: The key is to keep the report concise and simple. Avoid jargon and use Plain English.
sentences.chinese: 報告關鍵在於簡單明瞭，要用大白話，不要使用行話。

sentences.english: It is the most difficult to use simple words to express profound principles.
sentences.chinese: 用大白話講出深刻的道理是最難的。

sentences.english: Cauliflower is nothing but a cabbage with a college education.
sentences.chinese: 譯成大白話就是“甘藍識了字，就叫花菜了”。
